content:
Web-public channel created by David Bryant. Description:

Special Interest Group for Bytecode Alliance Community activities and outreach
Really excited to see this as a SIG :grinning:

Hey all! Karen, one of the co-chairs for SIG-Community here :wave: Our other co-chair is @Divya Mohan!

We're excited to get this SIG kicked off and want to invite everyone to join us for our first call next week on Tues June 4 at 3:30pm UTC (11:30 AM ET /09:00 PM IST)! We'll be scoping out our first action items. The agenda can be found here: https://github.com/bytecodealliance/meetings/blob/main/SIG-Community/2024/community-06-04.md (please feel free to add items).

Please check back closer to the time for a Zoom link :) See you on Tuesday!

meetings/SIG-Community/2024/community-06-04.md at main Â· bytecodealliance/meetings
Contribute to bytecodealliance/meetings development by creating an account on GitHub.

Here's a Zoom video meeting link and details for our first SIG-Community meeting, which happens today (June 4) at 3:30pm UTC (11:30am ET, 8:30am PT, 09:00PM IST). Please join us!

https://zoom.us/j/96177916928?pwd=2Caq2WVNZN8QrG1rVcME6hu9b3XIpJ.1
Meeting ID: 961 7791 6928
Passcode: 950771
Sorry to miss today's zoom! I'm at Wasm Research day at Carnegie Mellon.
Hi! I saw Divya's post about this SIG on LinkedIn! will join the next meeting :D appreciate your efforts on starting this!

as mentioned in #general , we're working on drafting a charter and figuring out our scope to best serve this community. if anyone has ideas on what you'd like to see from this SIG, can you please share them in this channel? we'll follow-up at our next SIG-Community meeting on June 18

We will be canceling today's meeting since several members aren't able to make the call. That being said, our next meeting will be July 2nd; let's use this time to continue brainstorming agenda items for the next calla and ideas on how this SIG can best serve the community.
@Divya Mohan does one of us need to sign in as the host in order to get a pass code?

Karen Chu said:

Divya Mohan does one of us need to sign in as the host in order to get a pass code?

Just saw this now.
